ResourceHeader.ResourceName: MMS-4 FPI DIS Level-2 Burst ion moments (CDF)
ResourceHeader.Description:
This dataset provides  the moments of the ion distribution function at the BURST cadence (150 ms) computed from the full distribution function and corrected from a number of effects (including the spacecraft electrostatic potential). The dataset comprises the main moments: density, velocity vector, temperatures (and associated pressure tensor), and heat flux. They are provided in GSE frame.
For more information on the FPI instruments, data set, and user guide, please see:
 MMS Science Data Center (https://lasp.colorado.edu/mms/sdc/public/datasets/fpi/)
 MMS FPI Data Users and Products Guide (https://lasp.colorado.edu/galaxy/display/MFDPG/MMS+FPI+Data+Users+and+Products+Guide)
 FPI Release Notes (https://lasp.colorado.edu/mms/sdc/public/datasets/fpi/mms-FPIReleaseNotes-220217.pdf)
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement:
FPI data, as a data set of the MMS-SMART data products, are open to all scientists and the public (Users).
Users should contact the MMS-SMART Principal Investigator (PI) J. L. Burch and B. Giles the FPI Lead to consult on the appropriate use of instrument data.
Users should acknowledge the sources of data used in all publications, presentations, and reports.
Please send information on the use of these data to:
    PI: J. L. Burch [jburch@swri.edu]
    FPI Lead: B. Giles [barbara.giles@gsfc.nasa.gov]
We suggest to add the following lines into the acknowledgments:
The authors acknowledge NASA, CNES (Centre National d'Etudes Spatiales) and CNRS (Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique) for their support to the MMS/FPI team and the CDPP (Centre de Données de la Physique des Plasmas) for the distribution of the MMS/SCM data.
and if PI/coI are not part of the publication list, then we suggest to add Specifically, we acknowledge J. L. Burch for use of data from the MMS-SMART mission, B. Giles for use of FPI data.
For more informations about data rights and rules, see MMS Science Data center
The following paper should also be used to reference:

Parameter.Name: Data Quality Error Flags
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Vector of Data Quality Indicator Flag Flags at Burst Start Time
Parameter.Caveats: A Value of Zero signifies no Quality Errors. For Non-Zero Values: Bit-0=Manually flagged Interval, Bit-1=Overcounting/Saturation Effects likely present in Sky Map, Bit-2=Reported Spacecraft Potential above 20 V, Bit-3=Invalid/Unavailable Spacecraft Potential, Bit-4=Significant (>10%) Cold Plasma (>10 eV) Component, Bit-5=Significant (>25%) Hot Plasma (>30 keV) Component, Bit-6=High Sonic Mach Number (V/Vth > 2.5), Bit-7=Low calculated Density (N_DIS ≤ 0.0 cm^-3), Bit-8=Bent Pipe Magnetic Field used instead of Burst l2pre Magnetic Field, Bit-9=Survey l2pre Magnetic Field used instead of Burst l2pre Magnetic Field, Bit-10=No internally generated Photoelectron Correction applied, Bit-11=Compression Pipeline Error, Bit-12=Spintone Calculation Error (DBCS only), Bit-13=Significant (≥20%) Penetrating Radiation

Parameter.Name: Compression Flag
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Compression Lossless/Lossy Indicator Flag at Survey Start Time
Parameter.Caveats: Compression Loss Indicator, 0=Lossless, 1=Lossy

Parameter.Name: Step Table Parity
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Step Table Parity, this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: The FPI/DIS alternates between two Tables, designated even (0) and odd (1).

Parameter.Name: Start Del-Phi Count
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Del-Phi (Observatory Spin Phase) Count at Burst Start Time
Parameter.Caveats: Nominally, the Spin Phase Counts range over [0000,5759] Counts. Each Count represents 1/16 of a Degree (0.0625°) of Observatory Spin Phase. Zero Spin Phase Angle indicates that the Observatory +X-axis is aligned with the Sun Sensor Axis.

Parameter.Name: Start Del-Phi Angle
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Del-Phi (Observatory Spin Phase) Angle at Burst Start Time
Parameter.Caveats: Nominally, the Spin Phase Angles range over [0°,360°). Each Count represents 1/16 of a Degree (0.0625°) of Observatory Spin Phase. Zero Spin Phase Angle indicates that the Observatory +X-axis is aligned with the Sun Sensor Axis.

Parameter.Name: Sector De-Spin P Value
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS This Variable records the P-Value used to De-Spin this Burst Sky Map onboard. See the FPI Documents for Details.
Parameter.Caveats: This Variable records the P-Value used to De-Spin this Burst Sky Map onboard. See the FPI Documents for Details.

Parameter.Name: Ion Energy Spectrum, DBCS +X Direction
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Energy Spectrum near the De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS, +X Axis during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction is within 45° (Polar and Azimuthal) of the +X Axis (Instrument Look Angles: 45° ≤ Theta < 135° and 135° ≤ Phi < 225°).

Parameter.Name: Ion Energy Spectrum, DBCS -X Direction
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Energy Spectrum near the De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS, -X Axis during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction is within 45° (Polar and Azimuthal) of the -X Axis (Instrument Look Angles: 45° ≤ Theta < 135° and Phi ≥ 315° or Phi < 45°).

Parameter.Name: Ion Energy Spectrum, DBCS +Y Direction
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Energy Spectrum near the De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS, +Y Axis during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction is within 45° (Polar and Azimuthal) of the +Y Axis (Instrument Look Angles: 45° ≤ Theta < 135° and 225° ≤ Phi < 315°).

Parameter.Name: Ion Energy Spectrum, DBCS -Y Direction
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Energy Spectrum near the De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS, -Y Axis during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction is within 45° (Polar and Azimuthal) of the -Y Axis (Instrument Look Angles: 45° ≤ Theta < 135° and 45° ≤ Phi < 135°).

Parameter.Name: Ion Energy Spectrum, DBCS +Z Direction
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Energy Spectrum near the De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS, +Z Axis during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction is within 45° (Polar and Azimuthal) of the +Z Axis (Instrument Look Angles: 135° ≤ Theta < 180° and 0° ≤ Phi < 360°).

Parameter.Name: Ion Energy Spectrum, DBCS -Z Direction
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Energy Spectrum near the De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS, -Z Axis during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction is within 45° (Polar and Azimuthal) of the -Z Axis (Instrument Look Angles: 0° ≤ Theta < 45° and 0° ≤ Phi < 360°).

Parameter.Name: Ion Energy Spectrum, Omni-Directional
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Omni-Directional Ion Energy Spectrum during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over all Directions (Flow or Look)

Parameter.Name: Ion Energy Spectrum, Background
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Energy Spectrum Background during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: Background Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over all Directions (Flow or Look), Background Level.

Parameter.Name: Ion Number Density, Background
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Number Density Background during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: Background Number Density derived via Integration of the estimated Background Differential Energy Flux.

Parameter.Name: Ion Number Density
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Number Density during this Burst

Parameter.Name: Ion Number Density, Error
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Number Density Error during this Burst

Parameter.Name: Ion Number Density, Extrapolation, Low
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Estimated Contribution (via Extrapolation to Zero) to the Ion Number Density Integral below 10 eV

Parameter.Name: Ion Number Density, Extrapolation, High
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Estimated Contribution (via Extrapolation to Infinity) to the Ion Number Density Integral above 30 keV

Parameter.Name: Ion Bulk Velocity Vector, DBCS
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Bulk Velocity Vector during this Burst, De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS

Parameter.Name: Ion Bulk Velocity Spintone Vector, DBCS
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Bulk Velocity estimated Spintone Vector during this Burst, De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS
Parameter.Caveats: Estimated Systematic Error (Positive or Negative) in Spin Plane Bulk Velocity (km/s) due to imperfect Sensor Suite Flat-Fielding. This Error can be subtracted from the Bulk Velocity to obtain the corrected Velocity Vector.

Parameter.Name: Ion Bulk Velocity Vector, GSE
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Bulk Velocity Vector during this Burst in Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Ion Bulk Velocity Spintone Vector, GSE
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Bulk Velocity estimated Spintone Vector during this Burst in Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: Estimated Systematic Error (Positive or Negative) in Spin Plane Bulk Velocity (km/s) due to imperfect Sensor Suite Flat-Fielding. This Error can be subtracted from the Bulk Velocity to obtain the corrected Velocity Vector.

Parameter.Name: Ion Bulk Velocity Error Vector
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Bulk Velocity Error Vector during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: The Error can be applied to Data expressed by using either DBCS or GSE Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Ion Pressure Tensor, DBCS
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Pressure Tensor during this Burst, De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS. Column 1 Labels from : [x,y,z]. Column 2 Labels from : [x,y,z].
Parameter.Caveats: The 3⨯3 Matrix is represented as: Row 1: Pxx Pxy Pxz, Row 2: Pyx Pyy Pyz, Row 3: Pzx Pzy Pzz. Note that Pij=Pji.

Parameter.Name: Ion Pressure Tensor, GSE
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Pressure Tensor during this Burst in Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Coordinates. Column 1 Labels from : [x,y,z]. Column 2 Labels from : [x,y,z].
Parameter.Caveats: The 3⨯3 Matrix is represented as: Row 1: Pxx Pxy Pxz, Row 2: Pyx Pyy Pyz, Row 3: Pzx Pzy Pzz. Note that Pij=Pji.

Parameter.Name: Ion Pressure Tensor, Error
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Pressure Tensor Error during this Burst. Column 1 Labels from : [x,y,z]. Column 2 Labels from : [x,y,z].
Parameter.Caveats: The Error can be applied to Data expressed by using either DBCS or GSE Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Ion Pressure, Background
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Pressure Background during this Survey

Parameter.Name: Ion Temperature Tensor, DBCS
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Temperature Tensor during this Burst, De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS. Column 1 Labels from : [x,y,z]. Column 2 Labels from : [x,y,z].
Parameter.Caveats: The 3⨯3 Matrix is represented as: Row 1: Txx Txy Txz, Row 2: Tyx Tyy Tyz, Row 3: Tzx Tzy Tzz. Note that Tij=Tji.

Parameter.Name: Ion Temperature Tensor, GSE
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Temperature Tensor during this Burst in Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Coordinates. Column 1 Labels from : [x,y,z]. Column 2 Labels from : [x,y,z].
Parameter.Caveats: The 3⨯3 Matrix is represented as: Row 1: Txx Txy Txz, Row 2: Tyx Tyy Tyz, Row 3: Tzx Tzy Tzz. Note that Tij=Tji.

Parameter.Name: Ion Temperature Tensor, Error
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Temperature Tensor Error during this Burst. Column 1 Labels from : [x,y,z]. Column 2 Labels from : [x,y,z].
Parameter.Caveats: The Error can be applied to Data expressed by using either DBCS or GSE Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Ion Heat Flux Vector, DBCS
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Heat Flux Vector Vector during this Burst, De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS

Parameter.Name: Ion Heat Flux Vector, GSE
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Heat Flux Vector Vector during this Burst in Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Ion Heat Flux Error Vector
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Heat Flux Error Vector during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: The Error can be applied to Data expressed by using either DBCS or GSE Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Ion Sky Map Energy
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Burst Sky Map Parity 0/1 Energy
Parameter.Caveats: Energies (Parity 0/1) in the 64-step FPI Energy Table

Parameter.Name: Ion Sky Map Energy, Delta Value
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Burst Sky Map Energy, Delta Value
Parameter.Caveats: Note that the Deltas are provided to indicate that the FPI is reporting the Energy Bin Centers. The Deltas do not necessarily reflect the Energy Bandwidth that is sampled by the FPI for a given Energy Step.

Parameter.Name: Ion Parallel Temperature
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Parallel Temperature during this BP

Parameter.Name: Ion Perpendicular Temperature
Parameter.Description: MMS4 FPI/DIS Ion Perpendicular Temperature during this BP
